definition: vague/ambiguous/equivocal/dubious
(of daylight) dim/obscure/clandestine/dubious
to conceal/dark
shady relationship/affair/adulterous relationship

sentences.english: For example, mysterious purple, ambiguous rose, spacious white.
sentences.chinese: 想過用神祕的紫，曖昧的玫，空靈的白。

sentences.english: There was a "dangerous cosiness" between the bank and Kenya's government.
sentences.chinese: 世行與肯尼亞政府之間總有種曖昧的“危險的默契”。

sentences.english: Caliban's exact nature continues to be slightly ambiguous later.
sentences.chinese: 醜陋的精確自然繼續些微曖昧比較遲的。

sentences.english: Barefaced attitude is exceeding and ambiguous fetching illusion is infinite.
sentences.chinese: 露骨的姿態極度曖昧引人幻想無限。

sentences.english: An interesting lyric of Michaels, cryptic and ambiguous.
sentences.chinese: 邁克爾斯有趣的抒情，神祕和曖昧。

sentences.english: Should you confess if you’ve had an affair?
sentences.chinese: 如果你曾經跟別人有曖昧關係，你是否應該坦白？

sentences.english: She sings Shadiness in the rest room if nothing?
sentences.chinese: 沒有她會在廁所裏面唱曖昧？

sentences.english: He and I are ambiguous between the insincerely.
sentences.chinese: 我和他之間的曖昧都是言不由衷。

sentences.english: The author 's style suggests a certain ambiguity in his moral view.
sentences.chinese: 該作家的風格表明其道德觀有點曖昧不明。
他態度非常友好，但是態度曖昧。

sentences.english: You who're so good with words and at keeping things vague.
sentences.chinese: 你向來善於文辭與曖昧不明。

sentences.english: They have this kind of unclear relationship for some months.
sentences.chinese: 他們這種曖昧關係持續了幾個月。

sentences.english: Lindsay has flashed onlookers a number of times in cars and clubs.
sentences.chinese: 林賽不止一次在酒吧或車裏與觀衆曖昧而被偷拍。

sentences.english: Youth is a play waltzes, half sad affair.
sentences.chinese: 青春是一首奏響的圓舞曲，一半憂傷一半曖昧。

sentences.english: Looks like those two are up to something, huh?
sentences.chinese: 那兩人最近關係好象有點曖昧，是嗎？

sentences.english: The origin of most of our domestic animals will probably forever remain vague.
sentences.chinese: 大部分家養動物的來源，也許會永遠曖昧不明。

definition: the opposite sex/of the opposite sex/heterosexual/different in nature
(romantic) love/CL:個|个[ge4],場|场[chang3]/in love/to have an affair
to be in a tangle/to nag
lover/sweetheart
to be in contact (with sb)/to associate/to interact/to get along (well, poorly)
surname Tan
to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss
to sound out/to probe/to feel out/to try out
now hot, now cold/(of one's mood, affection etc) to alternate
counterpart/other person involved/opposite side/other side/receiving party
single-minded/concentrated
to court/to go steady/to be dating
to be secretly in love with
passive
to intertwine/to band together (with)/to link up (with)/twisted/tangled/confused/to be at a loss
to take the initiative/to do sth of one's own accord/spontaneous/active/opposite: passive 被動|被动[bei4 dong4]/drive (of gears and shafts etc)
romance/love (romantic)/CL:個|个[ge4],份[fen4]
